intro: Platea corniculata, commonly known as the horned plant or horned crown, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like structures on its leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Platea corniculata is often found growing in rocky or mountainous regions, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
